Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.Client
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalClient
public class Client extends Object
This singleton class implements the client operation: connecting, reading, writing, disconnecting, ...

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    exit()
    Kindly closes the connection with the server sending him a notification message
    static Client
    getClient()
    Gets the instance of the Client singleton
    ClientController
    getController()
    Returns the clientController singleton, you can also get it calling ClientController.getClientController()
    String
    getNickname()
    Returns the nickname associated to this client if there is already a nickname, otherwise returns null
    void
    heartbeat()
    Creates a thread that periodically calls keepAlive() to keep alive the connection with the server
    void
    keepAlive()
    Keeps alive the connection with the server sending a ping
    void
    setSocket​(String address, int port)
    This method sets the connection parameters and starts the connection.
    void
    setView​(boolean cliChoice)
    Creates the correct view, sets it inside the controller and creates a separate thread to handle player inputs In case of CLI the thread is daemon, in case of GUI not
    void
    startClient()
    This method starts the client, beginning the reading cycle and computing each time a message is read and parsed.
    void
    terminateConnection()
    Closes streams and socket.
    boolean
    writeMessage​(CtoSMessage msg)
    This method sends the message to the server after parsing it.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getClient

      public static Client getClient()
      Gets the instance of the Client singleton
      Returns:
      the instance of the Client singleton

    • setSocket

      public void setSocket​(String address, int port)
      This method sets the connection parameters and starts the connection. It also initializes all the necessary components for reading/writing via input/output stream services.
      Parameters:
      address - the ip address of the server
      port - the port

    • setView

      public void setView​(boolean cliChoice)
      Creates the correct view, sets it inside the controller and creates a separate thread to handle player inputs In case of CLI the thread is daemon, in case of GUI not
      Parameters:
      cliChoice - if true set up a CLI, if false set up a GUI

    • startClient

      public void startClient()
      This method starts the client, beginning the reading cycle and computing each time a message is read and parsed.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Kindly closes the connection with the server sending him a notification message

    • writeMessage

      public boolean writeMessage​(CtoSMessage msg)
      This method sends the message to the server after parsing it.
      Parameters:
      msg - the message still to parse
      Returns:
      true if the send goes well

    • keepAlive

      public void keepAlive()
      Keeps alive the connection with the server sending a ping

    • terminateConnection

      public void terminateConnection()
      Closes streams and socket.

    • getController

      public ClientController getController()
      Returns the clientController singleton, you can also get it calling ClientController.getClientController()
      Returns:
      the clientController instance

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Returns the nickname associated to this client if there is already a nickname, otherwise returns null
      Returns:
      the nickname associated to this client or null if this client hasn't a nickname yet

    • heartbeat

      public void heartbeat()
      Creates a thread that periodically calls keepAlive() to keep alive the connection with the server
